>
Mathematical Foundations for Electrical Engineering >Essential Mathematical Concepts and Applications
>
Linear Algebra & Systems
>
Matrix Operations:
>
Circuit Analysis: >
[R] [I] = [V] > R -R >-R R >0 R
>
>
I >I >I
>=
>
V >V >V >
>
Determinants: > = |R| ` 0 for unique solution >Cramer's Rule: I = /, I = /, I = / >
Applications: >" Kirchhoff's law systems >" Network analysis >" Power system calculations >" Filter design >
>
Trigonometry & Phasors
>
Trigonometric Functions:
>
>
(cos , sin )
>
sin >cos >
AC Waveforms: >v(t) = V_m sin(t + ) >i(t) = I_m cos(t + )
> Phasor: V = V_m = V_m e^(j) >
>
Complex Numbers
>
Complex Plane:
>
Real >Imag
>
Z = a + jb
>
>
a = |Z|cos >b = |Z|sin >
Forms: >Rectangular: Z = a + jb >Polar: Z = |Z| >Exponential: Z = |Z| e^(j) >|Z| = (a + b) >
>
Calculus
>
Derivatives: >i = C(dv/dt) >v = L(di/dt) >P = dW/dt
>Integrals: >v = (1/C)+i dt >W = +P dt >RMS = (1/T+vdt)
>Applications: >" Transient analysis >" Energy calculations >
>
Vector Analysis
>
Vector Operations:
>
A
>
B
>
A + B
>x >y >
Dot Product: >A B = |A||B|cos = A_x B_x + A_y B_y
>Cross Product: >A B = |A||B|sin
>Magnitude: >|A| = (A_x + A_y + A_z) >
Electromagnetic Applications: >Electric Field: E = F/q (N/C) >Magnetic Field: B (Tesla) >Force: F = q(E + v B) >Power: P = E J >Flux: = +B dA >Circulation: .E dl >
>
Fourier Analysis
>
Fourier Series:
>
Original Signal >
=
> Fundamental >
+
> Harmonics >
>
f(t) = a/2 + [acos(nt) + bsin(nt)] >a = (2/T)+f(t)cos(nt)dt >b = (2/T)+f(t)sin(nt)dt
>Frequency Domain: >F() = +f(t)e^(-jt)dt (Fourier Transform) >
Applications: >" Harmonic analysis in power systems >" Filter design and analysis >" Signal processing and communications >" Spectrum analysis >
>
Probability & Statistics
>
Statistical Measures:
>
>- >+ >
Mean: = (1/n)xb >Variance: ò = (1/n)(xb-) >Standard Deviation: = (ò) >RMS: (mean(x)) >
Reliability Engineering: >Failure Rate: (t) = f(t)/R(t) >MTBF = 1/ >Reliability: R(t) = e^(-t) >Availability: A = MTBF/(MTBF+MTTR)
>Applications: >" Power system reliability >" Component lifetime analysis >" Quality control >" Risk assessment >
>
Numerical Methods for Electrical Engineering
>
Root Finding >Newton-Raphson: >x = x - f(x)/f'(x) >Applications: >" Load flow analysis >" Nonlinear circuit solutions >
Numerical Integration >Trapezoidal Rule: >+f(x)dx H h/2[f(x)+2f(xb)+f(x)] >Applications: >" RMS calculations >" Energy computations >
ODE Solvers >Runge-Kutta 4th order: >y_{n+1} = y_n + h/6(k+2k+2k+k) >Applications: >" Transient analysis >" Dynamic systems >
Interpolation >Lagrange Polynomial: >P(x) = yb(x-x|)/(xb-x|) >Applications: >" Curve fitting >" Data approximation >
Matrix Methods >LU Decomposition: >[A] = [L][U] >Applications: >" Large system solutions >" Network analysis >
Optimization >Gradient Descent: >x_{k+1} = x_k - f(x_k) >Applications: >" Parameter estimation >" Design optimization >
Signal Processing >FFT Algorithm: >O(N log N) complexity >Applications: >" Spectral analysis >" Digital filtering >
>
Mathematical Software Tools
>
MATLAB >Matrix Laboratory >Numerical computing >
Python >NumPy, SciPy, SymPy >Scientific computing >
Mathematica >Symbolic computation >Advanced mathematics >
R >Statistical computing >Data analysis >
GNU Octave >MATLAB compatible >Open source >
SPICE >Circuit simulation >Electronic design >
CAD Tools >AutoCAD, SolidWorks >Design & drafting >
Simulink >System modeling >Dynamic systems >
PowerWorld >Power system analysis >Grid simulation >
>
Mathematical Applications in Electrical Engineering
>
Circuit Analysis >" Linear algebra for mesh/nodal analysis >" Complex numbers for AC analysis >" Differential equations for transients >" Fourier analysis for frequency response >" Laplace transforms for system analysis >
Power Systems >" Complex power calculations >" Load flow analysis (numerical methods) >" Fault analysis (matrix methods) >" Stability analysis (eigenvalues) >" Economic dispatch (optimization) >
Control Systems >" Transfer functions (Laplace domain) >" State space representation >" Stability analysis (Routh-Hurwitz) >" Frequency response (Bode plots) >" Digital control (z-transforms) >
Signal Processing >" Fourier transforms for spectrum >" Convolution for system response >" Digital filters (z-domain) >" Sampling and aliasing >" Discrete Fourier Transform >
Electromagnetics >" Vector calculus (Maxwell's equations) >" Partial differential equations >" Boundary value problems >" Finite element analysis >" Wave propagation >
Communications >" Probability for noise analysis >" Information theory >" Modulation techniques >" Error correction coding >" Channel capacity >
> Mathematical proficiency is fundamental to electrical engineering success. Practice these concepts regularly and understand their physical interpretations.
